verses.text: Woe to her that is filthy and polluted, to the oppressing city!
She obeyed not the voice; she received not correction; She trusted not in the \sc Lord\sc*; she drew not near to her God.
Her princes within her \add are\add* roaring lions; Her judges \add are\add* evening wolves; They gnaw not the bones till the morrow.
Her prophets \add are\add* light \add and\add* treacherous persons: Her priests have polluted the sanctuary, they have done violence to the law.
The just \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* in the midst thereof; he will not do iniquity: Every morning doth he bring his judgment to light, he faileth not; But the unjust knoweth no shame.
I have cut off \add the\add* nations: their towers are desolate; I made their streets waste, that none passeth by: Their cities are destroyed, so that there is no man, that there is none inhabitant.
I said, Surely thou wilt fear me, thou wilt receive instruction; So their dwelling should not be cut off, howsoever I punished them: But they rose early, \add and\add* corrupted all their doings.

Therefore wait ye upon me, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, Until the day that I rise up to the prey: For my determination \add is\add* to gather the nations, That I may assemble the kingdoms, To pour upon them mine indignation, \add even\add* all my fierce anger: For all the earth shall be devoured with the fire of my jealousy.
For then will I turn to the people a pure language, That they may all call upon the name of the \sc Lord\sc*, To serve him \add with\add* one consent.
From beyond the rivers of Ethiopia My suppliants, \add even\add* the daughter of my dispersed, shall bring mine offering.

In that day shalt thou not be ashamed for all thy doings, Wherein thou hast transgressed against me: For then I will take away out of the midst of thee them that rejoice in thy pride, And thou shalt no more be haughty because of my holy mountain.
I will also leave in the midst of thee an afflicted and poor people, And they shall trust in the name of the \sc Lord\sc*.
The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies; Neither shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth: For they shall feed and lie down, and none shall make \add them\add* afraid.
Sing, O daughter of Zion; shout, O Israel; Be glad and rejoice with all the heart, O daughter of Jerusalem.
The \sc Lord\sc* hath taken away thy judgments, he hath cast out thine enemy: The king of Israel, \add even\add* the \sc Lord\sc*, \add is\add* in the midst of thee: Thou shalt not see evil any more.
In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem, Fear thou not: \add And to\add* Zion, Let not thine hands be slack.
The \sc Lord\sc* thy God in the midst of thee \add is\add* mighty; He will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy; He will rest in his love, he will joy over thee with singing.
I will gather \add them that are\add* sorrowful for the solemn assembly, \add who\add* are of thee, \add To whom\add* the reproach of it \add was\add* a burden.

Behold, at that time I \add will\add* undo all that afflict thee: And I will save her that halteth, And gather her that was driven out; And I will get them praise and fame In every land where they have been put to shame.

At that time will I bring you \add again\add*, even in the time that I gather you: For I will make you a name and a praise among all people of the earth, When I turn back your captivity before your eyes, saith the \sc Lord\sc*.
